sections.title: Master the Moving Targets
sections.subtitle: Build a system for keeping tabs on every fluctuating dollar

sections.title: Lesson Roadmap
items: Understand why variable expenses derail budgets
Adopt tracking tools that fit your lifestyle
Translate tracking data into actionable decisions

sections.title: Why Variable Costs Matter
sections.content: During months when dining out, utilities, or transportation spike, your plan can fall apart if you only account for fixed bills. Tracking keeps you proactive instead of reactive, reducing surprises and guilt.

points.title: Categorize Clearly
points.description: Group similar expenses (food, mobility, lifestyle) to spot trends fast.

points.title: Capture Quickly
points.description: Record spending within 24 hours to preserve context and prevent forgetfulness.

points.title: Review Weekly
points.description: Look back every week, while details are fresh, to adjust the upcoming days.

sections.title: Data Turns to Insight
sections.content: Numbers show patterns. Once you see the pattern, you can change the outcome.

sections.title: Tools That Work
sections.content: Choose a method you will actually use: budgeting apps (YNAB, Monarch) for automation, spreadsheets for customization, or notebook/bullet journal for tactile tracking. The tool matters less than the habit of logging and reviewing.

sections.title: Create Your Tracking Workflow
steps: List the top five variable categories that cause monthly swings.
Select a tracking tool and set it up with matching categories.
Enable real-time transaction alerts or schedule a daily 5-minute logging session.
At the end of each week, compare your actual spend to your planned cap and note adjustments.
